instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: 820 00138 computer just stopped working. No damage of any kind.
threads.message:
820 00138 -
Computer not switching on
found <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR> burnt out so replaced, trying to switch on, no fan spin, then found short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>.
Before replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q8020</TRANSISTOR> the board was producing no heat at all. Injecting voltage, the main thing that gets warm is <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> and the other side of the board. I don't have any freeze spray at the moment, but until I do, with <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> getting warm is it game over for the computer or could it simply be a shorted out cap somewhere. With injecting 3.3v in the line, the board is drawing a bit more than 2.6a. The area of the board pictured has <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> on the other side of it. Whilst injecting 3.3v, the bigger caps in that area of the board do get warm and dry off isopropyl quite quickly.
TIA

threads.title: 820 00138 computer just stopped working. No damage of any kind.
threads.message:
If Si die of PCH doesn't get hot, remove the mentioned caps.
PCH can be changed, but you may need to replace FDMF6808 chips from CPU power supply too.
